Topic.Title: Adding a verb in Arabic tells me that it is an invalid attribute name.

Posts.EditableText:
Hello
I'm learning game programming and have tried to make an Arabic game. But I just started. However, I encountered the problem, adding a verb in Arabic tells me that it is an invalid attribute name.
Can anybody help me solve this problem!
Thanks in advance
Posts.HTML:
Hello
I'm learning game programming and have tried to make an Arabic game. But I just started. However, I encountered the problem, adding a verb in Arabic tells me that it is an invalid attribute name.
Can anybody help me solve this problem!
Thanks in advance

Posts.EditableText:
Attribute names are limited to ASCII, I believe.  Can you give the verb a romanised name?
If you're on the desktop version of Quest, you can edit the verb later to change its pattern and default message (the only part that a player sees) to whatever language you prefer, while leaving the property/attribute something that Quest finds acceptable.
Posts.HTML:
Attribute names are limited to ASCII, I believe. Can you give the verb a romanised name?
If you're on the desktop version of Quest, you can edit the verb later to change its pattern and default message (the only part that a player sees) to whatever language you prefer, while leaving the property/attribute something that Quest finds acceptable.
